title: Digital governance in tax-funded European healthcare systems: from the Back office to patient empowerment
research_description: This article discusses the role of digital technologies, including AI, in tax-funded European healthcare systems. It addresses the benefits of digital governance in improving transparency, accountability, patient empowerment, and medical effectiveness, particularly in oncology.
research_results: The study highlights the bureaucratic and organizational challenges in implementing digital healthcare governance in Europe. It emphasizes the potential of AI to transform healthcare delivery and patient empowerment, despite slow adoption and concerns about accountability and regulation.
future_research: Future research should explore how to accelerate the adoption of digital technologies in healthcare while ensuring that ethical and accountability standards are met, especially regarding patient data and the transparency of AI systems.
